natural problem:
If $\begin{vmatrix} a & b \\ c & d \end{vmatrix} = 4,$ then find
\[\begin{vmatrix} a & 7a + 3b \\ c & 7c  +3d \end{vmatrix}.\]
natural solution: Since $\begin{vmatrix} a & b \\ c & d \end{vmatrix} = 4,$ $ad - bc = 4.$  Then \[\begin{vmatrix} a & 7a + 3b \\ c & 7c  +3d \end{vmatrix} = a(7c + 3d) - (7a + 3b)c = 3ad - 3bc = 3(ad - bc) = \boxed{12}.\]

a_0.formal problem:
theorem
fixes a b c d :: real
assumes h0 : "a * d - b * c = 4"
shows  "a * (7 * c + 3 * d) - (7 * a + 3 * b) * c = 12"
a_0.formal solution:
(* ### Problem
 If $\begin{vmatrix} a & b \\ c & d \end{vmatrix} = 4,$ then find
\[\begin{vmatrix} a & 7a + 3b \\ c & 7c  +3d \end{vmatrix}.\] The final Answer is 12
 ### Proof
 Since $\begin{vmatrix} a & b \\ c & d \end{vmatrix} = 4,$ $ad - bc = 4.$  Then \[\begin{vmatrix} a & 7a + 3b \\ c & 7c  +3d \end{vmatrix} = a(7c + 3d) - (7a + 3b)c = 3ad - 3bc = 3(ad - bc) = \boxed{12}.\]
 *)

theorem
fixes a b c d :: real
assumes h0 : "a * d - b * c = 4"
shows  "a * (7 * c + 3 * d) - (7 * a + 3 * b) * c = 12"
 proof- 
  show ?thesis sledgehammer
a_0.informal problem: Given the equation $ad - bc = 4$, calculate the value of $a(7c+3d)-(7a+3b)c$. The final answer is 12.
